byline.contributor: Meridith Kohut and María Eugenia Díaz contributed reporting.
byline.original: By NICHOLAS CASEY and PATRICIA TORRES

abstract: Venezuela’s government, led by Pres Nicolas Maduro, wants to give away deeds to hundreds of thousands of government-built homes in order to win loyalties of poor; homeownership would create capital for those who do not have it, something that could lead to long-term social mobility.
lead_paragraph: Venezuela’s newly empowered opposition wants to give away the deeds to hundreds of thousands of government-built homes — to win the loyalties of the poor.

headline.main: Foes May Hate Hugo Chávez, but They Like His Political Playbook
headline.print_headline: Old Adversaries of Chávez Take a Page From His Playbook

snippet: Venezuela’s newly empowered opposition wants to give away the deeds to hundreds of thousands of government-built homes — to win the loyalties of the poor.
